channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Corner of kylemore road, 9th December
item.description:
Light for no left turn is broken. Drivers are turning left accidentally at night. Please repair light asap. Makes the area very dark too as street light on sherriff road opposite sherriff court is also broken
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77, Sherriff Road, Kilburn, Greater London

item.title: A washing machine has been dumped outside my house, 9th December
item.description:
We are the owners of 18 Kersley Road and are having painting work done. It seems as though someone has dumped their washing machine here, taking advantage of the fact it looks like we are having renovation work done! Please can this be removed ASAP.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kersley Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Garbage situation continues to be neglected, 9th December
item.description:
The continual refusal of the council to address this situation is truly demoralising, having lived in Greenwich for long enough to remember a time when it was actually maintained properly. It’s also galling because not only have I personally made this exact complaint a number of times now (after which it was marked “resolved” when it clearly was not in any way resolved), I’ve become aware that my fellow Combedale Road dwellers have made similar complaints, which have also been ignored. I implore the council to please address this situation. Not only is it unhygienic, but it encourages further litter by demonstrating that nobody cares. Based on my knowledge of the people who actually live on Combedale Road this couldn’t be farther from the truth. A neighbour’s suggestion was to simply remove the bins in this location because it only encourages fly tipping. I think this is wise, but I’m also open to other solutions. I simply ask that you address the situation rather than continuing to ignore it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woolwich Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous Flytipping, 9th December
item.description:
Raising this again as previous reports have been resolved with no action. For a considerable period, the area has been repeatedly used as a dumping ground for waste, including black bags, discarded furniture and various other refuse. In addition, it is unfortunately common to witness people relieving themselves in the street, including one instance when a drug addict urinated on our doorstep after being asked to move on. This situation has become not only unpleasant but a significant health and biohazard risk for all residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24a, Marshalsea Road, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
